instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi doctor,What is the difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,What is the difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik?

### Response:IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik are both types of laser eye surgery used to correct vision problems such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism. However, they differ in the way they perform the procedure.

IntraLasik is a traditional method of laser eye surgery where a thin flap is created on the surface of the cornea using a femtosecond laser. The surgeon then lifts the flap and uses another laser to reshape the cornea. After the reshaping is complete, the flap is put back in place.

Contoura Lasik, on the other hand, is a customized version of LASIK surgery. Instead of using a generic corneal map, Contoura Lasik uses advanced imaging technology to create a highly detailed three-dimensional map of the cornea. This map is then used to precisely guide the laser during the reshaping process. The benefit of this customization is improved accuracy and potentially better visual outcomes for patients.

In summary, the main difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik is the level of customization and accuracy in corneal mapping. Contoura Lasik offers a more precise and personalized approach compared to IntraLasik.

input: Hello doctor,For almost a week now I have had recurring random pain just behind both of my ear lobes. It has been almost three weeks since I stopped Lyrica, Pregabalin completely for back pain. For the last week I have been experiencing something different which can be best described as random pressure or light pain almost behind both the ear lobes, sometimes the feeling is localized just there other times it travels towards the neck, occasionally towards the mastoid bone or it extends towards the lower jawline. I have been crazily searching to see if this is a result of any swollen lymph node fearing cancer but I could not find anything out of the ordinary on the body. Very rarely I feel this pressure going upwards to the ear and even more rarely a sudden pain arises inside the ear too but I hear no ringing or sounds. The weirdest thing is today I woke up with this sensation and I could feel heaviness behind my ears.This has come after an acute sinus infection, cough, night sweats (for which I had to take antibiotics) that hit me when I started tapering off Lyrica last month. I have had chronic sinus issues in the past too but this one was different, never had it progress to this level. I have uploaded an image of where exactly the pain or pressure originates but right now the pain or pressure is pretty spread out randomly across the neck. Can you please tell me what is going on and what could be the cause of this pain or pressure? Then 26th pinkish brownish spotting occurred, 27th morning I did pregnancy test by urine, it came negative, and at 8 AM had brownish spotting, 28th had brownish spotting too. Please help me to know whether it is implantation bleeding or anything else.

TMJ disorders involve dysfunction of the jaw joint, which can lead to symptoms such as jaw pain, headaches, and tinnitus. The movement of the jaw during orthodontic treatment can potentially aggravate or exacerbate existing TMJ issues, resulting in tinnitus symptoms.

It is important to consult with your orthodontist and an ENT specialist to further evaluate your symptoms and determine the appropriate course of action. ### Response:Based on the description you provided, it is difficult to determine the exact nature of the freckle on your foot. Freckles are typically small, round or oval-shaped spots that occur due to an increase in melanocytes (pigment-producing cells) in the skin. They can occur anywhere on the body, including the foot.

However, there are a few possibilities for what the freckle could be:

1. Benign: Freckles are usually harmless and do not require medical intervention. They often do not change in size or color over time.
2. Mole: A mole is a pigmented spot on the skin that may or may not have a defined border. While most moles are benign, some can be cancerous. If the freckle has changed in size, shape, or color recently, it would be advisable to have it evaluated by a dermatologist.
3. Skin tag: Skin tags are small, flesh-colored growths that commonly occur on the neck, armpits, or groin area. They are usually painless and not cancerous.
4. Wart: Warts are caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV) and can appear as small, rough growths on the foot. They are usually painful, especially if located on a pressure point.

Since

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,I am 35 years old. My period was a month back. It sustained for four days. I generally use 3 to 4 pads in my periods. I had sex 10 days later. On the very next day, I had two Ovral G at around 9 AM and there after 12 hours again two Ovral G tablets. I noticed my period 12 days later, though it lasted for four days, the period was less and usually, my period happens four days earlier. In this month, it was six days earlier. I did hCG beta blood test. I am sending you the report. Can I be pregnant or conceive? Please advise because I want to abort. I am an unmarried woman. Can the blood test be wrong? What laboratory test I should do to get to know whether the fetus is there beyond uterus (ectopic pregnancy) as I m 35+. When should I go for ultrasound vagina testing to get the true picture? After that I did not have any sex, so then again can I be pregnant and that could not be detected now and can be detected on later?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am 35 years old. My period was a month back. It sustained for four days. I generally use 3 to 4 pads in my periods. I had sex 10 days later. On the very next day, I had two Ovral G at around 9 AM and there after 12 hours again two Ovral G tablets. I noticed my period 12 days later, though it lasted for four days, the period was less and usually, my period happens four days earlier. In this month, it was six days earlier. I did hCG beta blood test. I am sending you the report. Can I be pregnant or conceive? Please advise because I want to abort. I am an unmarried woman. Can the blood test be wrong? What laboratory test I should do to get to know whether the fetus is there beyond uterus (ectopic pregnancy) as I m 35+. When should I go for ultrasound vagina testing to get the true picture? After that I did not have any sex, so then again can I be pregnant and that could not be detected now and can be detected on later?

### Response:Based on the information provided, it is possible that you may be pregnant. The change in your menstrual cycle and the occurrence of bleeding after taking Ovral G can be indicative of early pregnancy.

To confirm whether you are pregnant or not, I would recommend doing a urine pregnancy test. This test can detect the presence of pregnancy hormone in your urine. If the test is positive, it indicates pregnancy.

If the urine test is positive, I would suggest scheduling an appointment with your healthcare provider for a blood test to confirm the pregnancy. This blood test measures the level of hCG (human chorionic gonadotropin) in your blood, which is a pregnancy hormone produced by the placenta.

Additionally, if there is a suspicion of an ectopic pregnancy (pregnancy outside of the uterus), further diagnostic tests may be required. These tests can include a transvaginal ultrasound or a blood test to measure the level of hCG.

It is important to consult with a healthcare provider who can evaluate your specific situation and guide you through the appropriate steps for testing and possible abortion procedures.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,I am 22 years old. I have been on the following antidepressants for two years. Morning: Modapex 50 one pill, Depakene, Lamotrigine 25 mg one pill. Night: Clozapex 25 mg half a pill, Mirtimash 30 g half a pill, Depakine Chrono 500 mg one pill, and Anafranil 75 mg half a pill.I used to take more but I stopped them over the past two years. For example, I used to take double the mentioned dose about nine months ago. I recovered from depression a couple of months ago. I started detoxing but with my doctor, the process was going way too slow and I have gained 45 kilograms over the past two years (25 in the past two months alone!) my muscles, my bones, and my joints started to hurt really bad because of my weight. Nothing works. I go to the gym every day, I workout but still I eat way too much because of the drugs and I cannot control it. My doctor does not want me to stop despite every hardship that I face and even refuses to decrease half a pill from the prescription. However, three weeks ago, I decided to cut all medications once and for all. I lost 7 kilograms, I stopped eating too much and just by cutting down the drugs I saved not less than 1800 calories per day. I started going to the gym more regularly. But here is the problem.Clozapex 25 and Mirtimash make me sleep and without them, I cannot sleep. No kidding, I have not slept in the past three weeks more than a maximum of 70 hours. Even those 70 hours, they are full of nightmares and I usually wake up after two hours with my mind confused and afraid and I cannot sleep back. I want to sleep. My eyes grew tired because I have been opening them for way too long. I do not want to give in and get back to the drugs because I am sick of them and I have had enough. 4. Encourage physical activity: Regular exercise can stimulate bowel movements.
5. Consult a pediatrician: If the above measures do not improve your son's symptoms after a few weeks, it would be advisable to consult a pediatrician for further evaluation and guidance.

Remember, it is essential to address constipation promptly to prevent complications. If you have any concerns

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,I have personal dermatitis. I was prescribed 12 weeks of 100 mg Doxycycline. However, I am skeptical about taking antibiotics as I have read that with a lot of people the rash returns upon finishing treatment. Also, it can mess up your gut which is apparently linked to perioral dermatitis. I have gone gluten, dairy and sugar free, started Probiotics, Zinc and Omega 3 supplements and the rash still persists. I also use Metro gel and also it helps my rash is still there. It is mild but is very annoying and sore. If I take antibiotics will it make things worse? Or should I go get allergy testing? I have also cut out flouride toothpaste and eliminated SLS.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I have personal dermatitis. I was prescribed 12 weeks of 100 mg Doxycycline. However, I am skeptical about taking antibiotics as I have read that with a lot of people the rash returns upon finishing treatment. Also, it can mess up your gut which is apparently linked to perioral dermatitis. I have gone gluten, dairy and sugar free, started Probiotics, Zinc and Omega 3 supplements and the rash still persists. I also use Metro gel and also it helps my rash is still there. It is mild but is very annoying and sore. If I take antibiotics will it make things worse? Or should I go get allergy testing? I have also cut out flouride toothpaste and eliminated SLS.

### Response:Based on your description, it seems like you have been trying various approaches to manage your personal dermatitis. It's great that you have made changes to your diet and are incorporating supplements. However, it is important to note that dermatitis is a complex condition with multiple potential causes, and finding the right treatment approach can be challenging.

While it is common for some individuals to experience a return of their rash after completing antibiotic treatment, this does not necessarily mean that antibiotics will worsen your condition. In many cases, the initial improvement seen with antibiotics is due to their ability to reduce inflammation and control bacterial overgrowth.

Before jumping to the conclusion that antibiotics will make things worse, it would be advisable to give them a chance. It is recommended to complete the full course of antibiotics as prescribed by your doctor, even if you start seeing improvement before the end of treatment. This will help ensure that all bacteria causing the infection are eradicated.

If your symptoms persist despite completing the full course of antibiotics, it may be helpful to consult with an allergist or immunologist for further evaluation. Allergy testing can help identify any specific allergens that may be contributing to your symptoms.

In addition to antibiotics

input: Hello doctor, I had seven teeth extracted today, just the roots. Anyway, over two of the teeth the dentist said there was an infection. I did not get any antibiotics, but she cleaned the area after. There is a lot of swelling in that area, and the gums are real red and like an ulcer. But not much pain. Is this normal? How do I know if it is infected or dry socket? Or anything else it could be?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor, I had seven teeth extracted today, just the roots. Anyway, over two of the teeth the dentist said there was an infection. I did not get any antibiotics, but she cleaned the area after. There is a lot of swelling in that area, and the gums are real red and like an ulcer. But not much pain. Is this normal? How do I know if it is infected or dry socket? Or anything else it could be?

### Response:Based on the patient's description, it is possible that the extraction site may be infected. However, it could also be a case of dry socket. To determine the exact cause, a thorough examination of the area is necessary.

Here are the possible diagnoses based on the symptoms mentioned:
1. Infection: Presence of pus, swelling, redness, and pain are common signs of an infection.
2. Dry socket: This occurs when the blood clot that normally forms after extraction is dislodged or never forms in the first place. Symptoms include severe pain, exposed bone, and an open wound.
3. Other possibilities: Other conditions such as gum disease or abscesses may also cause similar symptoms.

I recommend the patient to schedule an appointment with their dentist or oral surgeon for a thorough evaluation. The healthcare professional will assess the area, take a detailed medical history, and may order additional tests if needed. Treatment options will depend on the diagnosis.

input: Hello doctor,1. Why we are getting frequent colds?2. What can be done to reduce the amount of colds we are getting?
raw_output:

### Input:
Hello doctor,1. Why we are getting frequent colds?2. What can be done to reduce the amount of colds we are getting?

### Response:1. Frequent colds can be caused by various factors. One common reason is exposure to viruses, especially when in close contact with someone who has a cold. Other factors that can contribute to frequent colds include weakened immune system, lack of sleep, stress, poor diet, and smoking.

2. To reduce the amount of colds you are getting, here are some suggestions:
- Wash your hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
- Avoid close contact with people who have colds or other respiratory infections.
- Practice good respiratory hygiene by covering your mouth and nose with a tissue or your elbow when coughing or sneezing.
- Keep your environment clean by regularly disinfecting commonly touched surfaces.
- Maintain a healthy lifestyle, including regular exercise, proper nutrition, and adequate sleep.
- Strengthen your immune system with regular exercise, a balanced diet, and stress management techniques.
- Avoid smoking and limit exposure to secondhand smoke.

It is important to note that while these measures can help reduce the frequency of colds, they do not provide 100% protection against viral infections.

It is important to note that while these measures can help reduce the frequency of colds, they do not provide 100% protection against viral infections.

input: Hi doctor,This is in regards to my daughter who is 5 years old. Four days back suddenly she developed a fever. Fever was around 100 degrees F. Yesterday her fever subsided and now she does not have the same. She did not have a cough, cold, etc. But she lost appetite and she also had left eye white area red. The redness also has disappeared now. She did complain of a little bit of nausea and headache. But yesterday everything subsided and she recovered well. But, yesterday night we saw red bumps around her face, forehead and chest area. It itches sometimes. I am attaching the image for your reference. These bumps are slightly raised. Rest she seems fine now. Her appetite has increased as well.On the second day of her fever, she fainted briefly (a little bit of saliva came out from her mouth) for 5 to 10 seconds. She recovered quickly in a minute or two. This happened in the early morning when she woke up and stood. She had moderately high fever throughout the night.

### Response:Based on the patient's description, it seems that your daughter may have experienced a viral infection. The symptoms of fever, loss of appetite, redness in the eye area, and headache are consistent with a viral infection.

The appearance of red bumps on her face, forehead, and chest area could be due to a condition called roseola, which is a common viral infection in children. Roseola typically presents with a sudden onset of high fever, followed by the appearance of a rash composed of small, pink, or red spots. These spots may be raised slightly.

The brief fainting episode could also be related to the viral infection. Fever can sometimes cause a drop in blood pressure, leading to brief loss of consciousness. It is important to note that this episode lasted only for a few seconds and she recovered quickly.

It is recommended that you consult a healthcare professional for a thorough evaluation of your daughter's symptoms. They will be able to provide a proper diagnosis and recommend appropriate treatment options based on their findings.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 30 year old female, who weighs 130 lbs and 5.3 feet tall. For about 12 days, I have had consistent pain in the outer side of my breast up through my armpit. I have a tingling and slightly numb feeling in my left arm. I did not injure it, as far as I am aware. It started suddenly one morning. There is also a heaviness feeling in that whole area. When I look at the area, there is no physical change that I notice. I do not have lumps in breast or armpit that I could find.
raw_output:

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am a 30 year old female, who weighs 130 lbs and 5.3 feet tall. For about 12 days, I have had consistent pain in the outer side of my breast up through my armpit. I have a tingling and slightly numb feeling in my left arm. I did not injure it, as far as I am aware. It started suddenly one morning. There is also a heaviness feeling in that whole area. When I look at the area, there is no physical change that I notice. I do not have lumps in breast or armpit that I could find.

### Response:Based on your description, you may be experiencing symptoms of a condition called meralgia paresthetica. This is a compression neuropathy that occurs when the lateral femoral cutaneous nerve is compressed as it passes through the inguinal ligament.

The pain in the outer side of your breast up through your armpit, along with tingling and slightly numb feeling in your left arm, are consistent with the symptoms of meralgia paresthetica. The heaviness feeling in that whole area could be due to the compression of the nerve.

To confirm this diagnosis, I would recommend seeing a healthcare professional who can perform a physical examination and potentially order further tests such as an ultrasound or MRI if needed. Treatment options for meralgia paresthetica include conservative measures like physical therapy, stretching exercises, and avoiding activities that aggravate the symptoms. In some cases, surgery may be required if conservative treatments are unsuccessful.

It's important to consult with a healthcare professional for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment plan.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 30 year old male. I got married a year back. My problem is low sexual drive. Are there any safe medicines to induce sexual desire? Also, my penis is circumcised. So, my penile glans are dry and insensitive. Is there any topical cream available to increase the sensitivity of my penis? Is L arginine cream effective? Please suggest some medicines without side effects.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I am a 30 year old male. I got married a year back. My problem is low sexual drive. Are there any safe medicines to induce sexual desire? Also, my penis is circumcised. So, my penile glans are dry and insensitive. Is there any topical cream available to increase the sensitivity of my penis? Is L arginine cream effective? Please suggest some medicines without side effects.

### Response:Hello,

I understand your concerns about your low sexual drive and the dry and insensitive glans penis. There are several medications available that can help increase sexual desire and sensitivity in men. However, it is important to consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new medication.

One option for increasing sexual desire is testosterone replacement therapy (TRT). Testosterone is a hormone that plays a key role in sexual desire and arousal. If your testosterone levels are low, your doctor may prescribe TRT to help improve your sexual desire.

Another medication commonly used to treat low sexual desire is called PDE-5 inhibitors, such as sildenafil (Viagra), tadalafil (Cialis), or vardenafil (Levitra). These medications work by relaxing the blood vessels, allowing increased blood flow to the penis and potentially improving erectile function.

In terms of topical creams, L-arginine cream is not effective in increasing penis sensitivity. However, there are other topical creams available that contain ingredients like lidocaine or benzocaine, which can provide temporary relief from penile sensitivity. It's important to speak with your doctor or a urologist to discuss these options and determine the most appropriate treatment for your specific situation.

input: Hello doctor,My fiancee is B positive and myself O negative. In the future, will there be any complications in my pregnancy?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,My fiancee is B positive and myself O negative. In the future, will there be any complications in my pregnancy?

### Response:As a medical expert, I can provide you with some information regarding the compatibility of blood types during pregnancy. 

B positive (B+), also known as B+, is considered a universal recipient because it can accept blood from any other blood type. On the other hand, O negative (O-) is considered a universal donor because it can donate blood to any other blood type.

In terms of pregnancy, there are no known specific complications related to the difference in blood types between the mother and father. However, it is important to note that Rh factor compatibility should also be taken into consideration. The Rh factor is a protein found on the surface of red blood cells. If the mother has Rh-negative blood and the father has Rh-positive blood, there may be an increased risk of fetal Rh incompatibility if the baby's blood enters the mother's bloodstream during pregnancy or delivery.

To ensure a smooth pregnancy, it is recommended that both parents consult with their healthcare providers to discuss their blood types and any potential risks or concerns. Regular prenatal care and monitoring can help identify and manage any potential issues that may arise during pregnancy.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 44-year-old male with a BMI of 26. During a recent health checkup of blood and urine, the following readings were observed. Protein 1+ detected in dipstick, serum uric acid at 9.2 mg/dL, MPV at 12.5 fL, FBS at 112 mg/dL, HbA1c at 5.5, cholesterol at 227 mg/dL, triglycerides at 181 mg/dL, VLDL is at 36.2 mg/dL, ALT/SGPT at 48 U/L. Serum creatinine at 1.23, increased from 0.99 tested six months back. Other than this, all others were normal. I also have been infected with hepatitis B twice and vaccinated for hepatitis B. I have been a diabetic for more than two years. The HbA1c vary between 5.5 and 6.5. The first one was done two years ago. I also have hypertension for more than five years. It is not very much under control. It varies from 135/80 to 150/100 and now it has reduced a bit to 140/90. I met my general physician who advised me to check my albumin to creatinine ratio. I tested it four times. The results are as follows:  55 ug/mg, 150 mg/g, 11.4 ug/mg, 37.5 mg/g. My ultrasonogram revealed fatty liver and cystitis. All the rest is fine. My ECG was fine. I have been advised to have a urine culture. My current medications are Telma-AM 40, Dynaglipt, Ecosprin AV 75, Levofloxacin, and CTD 12.5 mg. I am not able to understand why my albumin levels are so high and I would like to know how and when can they be rectified. I have attached reports for your further reference.

Firstly, the elevated serum uric acid level of 9.2 mg/dL suggests possible gout or kidney dysfunction. Gout is a form of arthritis caused by an accumulation of uric acid crystals in the joints. It can be managed with dietary changes and medications.

Fourthly, the elevated cholesterol level of 227 mg/dL and triglyceride level of 181 mg/dL indicate dyslipidemia, which is commonly seen

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,You were wonderful in allaying some health anxiety over some skin issues several months ago. So, I thought I would consult with you on another question pertaining to my son. Unfortunately, a combination of my health anxiety and the big mistake of searching online has my mind imagining the worst with regard to my son. My son is 19 years old and has no diagnosed medical issues. I noticed back when he was about eight or ten years old that he had a mark resembling a cafe au lait mark on his back, in the upper shoulder area. I had always asked the pediatrician to look at it during his yearly physicals, and they made nothing of it. Throughout the years it has grown a bit and has become darker and more rough in texture. It is probably slightly less than an inch in length and looks like a few small lesions grouped together. Again, I have brought it to the pediatrician\s attention and he was not concerned. Three months ago, I made an appointment for him and my other son with a dermatologist for a skin exam, and I pointed out the spots which I wanted to be checked in particular. We met with the physician\s assistant there, and my younger son had a peculiar spot I pointed out, of which the PA conducted a shave biopsy, which came back as a mildly atypical junctional nevus. For my older son, I pointed out the spot on his back/shoulder, and the PA diagnosed it as a linear epidermal nevus. She said the chances of it becoming dangerous are slim to none. It may darken throughout the years, and they will simply monitor it at yearly visits. Unfortunately, I went on to research online about epidermal nevi and of course I ran into information showing a possible link to epidermal nevus syndrome and all of its associated neurological and skeletal defects. As I said, he is 19 and has no medical issues, is extremely intelligent, etc. In your opinion, is it safe to say that I should not be concerned about those syndromes? I presume it is primarily related to the numerous and systemic epidermal nevi, which he does not have, and I would think it would have presented by now? And my last even more neurotic question. My online research led me to some information saying that a certain type of epidermal nevus could be related to a gene mutation that could be passed along to an offspring, with them having possible serious skin scaling conditions, etc. Again, he has just one solitary small epidermal nevus. No biopsy was done, as the PA did not feel it was necessary. Do you feel there is any need for me to worry about that potential genetic mutation? Thank you so much for reading my long query.

input: Hello doctor,My fiance is so obsessed with getting pregnant, she is 17 years old, and she does not want me to touch her in any way. She does not want to touch herself, and she washes her hands a lot. She is scared of everything like she thinks she can get pregnant somehow. Pleases help.
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,My fiance is so obsessed with getting pregnant, she is 17 years old, and she does not want me to touch her in any way. She does not want to touch herself, and she washes her hands a lot. She is scared of everything like she thinks she can get pregnant somehow. Pleases help.

### Response:I'm sorry to hear about your situation. It sounds like your fiance may be experiencing anxiety and fear related to pregnancy. This can be a common concern among young women, especially those who are trying to conceive. Here are a few suggestions that may help:

1. Communication: Try to have an open and honest conversation with your fiance about her concerns. Let her know that you are supportive of her decisions and that you care about her well-being.

2. Education: Provide accurate information about the mechanics of conception and the effectiveness of various methods of contraception. This can help alleviate some of her fears and give her a better understanding of how pregnancy occurs.

3. Relaxation techniques: Encourage your fiance to practice relaxation techniques such as deep breathing exercises or meditation. These can help reduce anxiety and promote overall well-being.

4. Professional guidance: Consider seeking the assistance of a healthcare professional, such as a gynecologist or counselor, who specializes in reproductive health. They can provide further guidance and support tailored to your fiance's specific needs.

Remember, it's important to approach the situation with empathy and understanding.

input: Hi doctor,My mother is suffering from chronic kidney disease, and her creatinine level is 9.8 mg/dL. She has a history of diabetes for the past 25 years. She is taking Insulin from the beginning. She has hypertension for the past 35 years. Her hemoglobin is about 11.0 gm/dL. Her eyesight has been damaged before four years now. Her urine output is seven to eight times (volume is 1 to 1.5 liters within 24 hours). Can she avoid dialysis and reduced creatinine level? Please help.

She has hypertension for the past 35 years. Her hemoglobin is about 11.0 gm/dL. Her eyesight has been damaged before four years now. Her urine output is seven to eight times (volume is 1 to 1.5 liters within 24 hours). Can she avoid dialysis and reduced creatinine level? Please help.

### Response:Based on the information provided, it seems that your mother is suffering from chronic kidney disease (CKD) and has several comorbidities including diabetes, hypertension, and damaged eyesight. The creatinine level of 9.8 mg/dL indicates impaired kidney function.

While it is possible for some patients with CKD to avoid dialysis, it depends on various factors such as the stage of kidney disease, underlying conditions, and overall health status. In this case, considering your mother's history of diabetes and hypertension, along with her damaged eyesight, it is likely that she may require dialysis or kidney transplantation at some point.

To help reduce the creatinine level, it is important to manage her underlying conditions effectively. This includes strict blood sugar control for diabetes, blood pressure management, and avoiding further damage to the kidneys. Additionally, addressing any other medical issues such as anemia can also help improve kidney function.

I would recommend consulting with a nephrologist or a healthcare professional specialized in kidney diseases to evaluate your mother's specific situation and provide personalized recommendations. They will be able to guide you further on the management and treatment options available.

input: Hi doctor,I am a 46 year old male. I have been having recurring otitis media every year since three years. I was treated with various courses of antibiotics. Amoxicillin is already resistant. So Cefpodoxime and recently Cefuroxime is being used for treatment. I would like to know if there is any permanent solution to cure otitis media as I have also heard it could cause meningitis. I am having another bout right now with my left ear drum is inflamed and this time Cefpodoxime cannot clear it. So, the specialist has put me on Cefuroxime. I am still on this course of antibiotics. I have back aches, cough with phlegm with low-grade fever and feel generally lethargic. I also have high-pitched tinnitus which is very loud. Can you please tell me if I can take a treatment where this issued can be fully resolved?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:

Can you please tell me if I can take a treatment where this issued can be fully resolved?

### Response:I'm sorry to hear about your recurring otitis media and the difficulties you're experiencing. Recurrent otitis media can be frustrating, especially when antibiotics become less effective.

The first step in treating otitis media is to identify and address the underlying cause. In your case, it seems that the infection is resistant to amoxicillin and has responded poorly to cefpodoxime and cefuroxime. This indicates that the bacteria causing the infection may be resistant to multiple antibiotics.

In such cases, it would be prudent to consult with an ear, nose, and throat (ENT) specialist who can assess the severity of your condition and determine the best course of action. They may consider additional diagnostic tests, such as a tympanometry or a culture and sensitivity test, to identify the specific bacteria causing the infection and determine its antibiotic susceptibility.

Based on the results of these tests, the ENT specialist may recommend further interventions, such as:

1. Surgical drainage: If there is a collection of pus or fluid in the middle ear, your doctor may perform a myringotomy and drainage procedure to help clear the infection.

2. Ventilation tubes: These small tubes are inserted

input: Hello doctor,My fiance got sickle cell SD. He is 27 and does not suffer from anything else. He takes medication and changes blood every 4 to 6 months. My question is does it affect his life expectancy?
raw_output:

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,My fiance got sickle cell SD. He is 27 and does not suffer from anything else. He takes medication and changes blood every 4 to 6 months. My question is does it affect his life expectancy?

### Response:Sickle cell disease (SCD) is a genetic disorder that affects the red blood cells. It can lead to various complications and can impact life expectancy.

In general, individuals with sickle cell disease have a shorter lifespan compared to those without the condition. The exact life expectancy may vary depending on several factors including access to proper medical care, management of complications, and overall health.

With advancements in medical management and treatment options, the life expectancy for individuals with sickle cell disease has improved over the years. However, it is still important for individuals with SCD to receive regular medical care, including blood transfusions, medications to prevent complications, and vaccinations to reduce the risk of infections.

It's essential for your fiancé to maintain regular follow-ups with a hematologist or a healthcare provider specializing in sickle cell disease. They will be able to provide personalized guidance and support in managing his condition and optimizing his overall health and well-being.

If the break is minor and not causing any pain or sensitivity, you may be able to save the tooth by:
- Rinse your mouth with warm water to clean the area.
- Use dental cement or toothpaste to temporarily restore the tooth.

The green appearance of your front teeth could be due to several reasons, including dental staining, plaque buildup, or even a sign of an underlying infection. To determine the cause, it would be best to consult with a dentist. They can examine your teeth, take X-rays if needed, and provide appropriate treatment options.

3. Deeply separated front teeth:
Deeply separated front teeth can be a sign of orthodontic issues or dental erosion.

input: Hello doctor,I have been dealing with some issues lately regarding panic attacks. I am not sure what it is, but it is scary. I had three panic attacks in one day, or I think they are panic attacks. My fingers will twitch consistently then lock up and lose circulation, along with my whole arm, on both sides. My upper right lip will switch and my eye will too, then my cheek all while pulling my head back in the same motion.And all, while this is happening someone, will be trying to talk to me but I cannot speak, almost like being catatonic. I am a little skeptical about if they are panic attacks or not. Mainly because I usually have them when I am stressed, but I had two more again today, and I am not even stressing about anything.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor,I have been dealing with some issues lately regarding panic attacks. I am not sure what it is, but it is scary. I had three panic attacks in one day, or I think they are panic attacks. My fingers will twitch consistently then lock up and lose circulation, along with my whole arm, on both sides. My upper right lip will switch and my eye will too, then my cheek all while pulling my head back in the same motion.And all, while this is happening someone, will be trying to talk to me but I cannot speak, almost like being catatonic. I am a little skeptical about if they are panic attacks or not. Mainly because I usually have them when I am stressed, but I had two more again today, and I am not even stressing about anything.

### Response:Based on the symptoms you described, it is possible that you are experiencing panic attacks. Panic attacks are characterized by sudden and intense feelings of fear or dread, accompanied by physical symptoms such as increased heart rate, sweating, trembling, shortness of breath, chest pain, dizziness, and a sense of impending doom.

The specific symptoms you mentioned, including finger twitching, loss of circulation, locking up of the arm, switching of the upper right lip, eye movement, and inability to speak, are consistent with the autonomic nervous system's "fight or flight" response during a panic attack.

It is important to note that panic attacks can occur without any apparent trigger and may even happen in the absence of stress. However, stress can certainly exacerbate the frequency and intensity of panic attacks.

I would recommend seeking medical evaluation from a healthcare professional, such as a primary care physician or a psychiatrist/psychologist, who can provide a proper diagnosis and develop an appropriate treatment plan for you. They may also conduct further assessments, such as blood tests or psychological evaluations, to rule out any underlying medical conditions that could be contributing to your symptoms.

In the meantime, it might be helpful to practice relaxation techniques, such as deep breathing exercises or mindfulness

It's important to note that these hormone levels alone do not provide a definitive diagn

input: Hello doctor,I am a 62-year-old male. I went for a routine X-ray, and the radiologist found some streakiness in the lower left lung. He said it appeared small and not significant, but it was adviced that I should come back in six months for a comparative X-ray and that it could just be a scar from an earlier infection.I have read that a small scar area is probably non-progressive but I have also read about IPF, and that fills me with fear. Spirometry test was normal as it was a physical exam. I am so scared that it might be a progressive disease, but I hope that it is just an old scar as it is really small. Otherwise mostly healthy with no cough or difficulty breathing at all. Are all lung scars progressive?
raw_output:

Spirometry test was normal as it was a physical exam. I am so scared that it might be a progressive disease, but I hope that it is just an old scar as it is really small. Otherwise mostly healthy with no cough or difficulty breathing at all. Are all lung scars progressive?

### Response:Based on the information provided, it is important to note that lung scars can vary in their characteristics and potential for progression. In general, most lung scars are not progressive and tend to remain stable over time. However, there are certain conditions such as idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) that can cause progressive scarring of the lungs.

Since your X-ray showed a small streakiness in the lower left lung, it is difficult to definitively determine whether it is an old scar or related to IPF without further evaluation. It would be prudent to follow the recommended course of action and return for a comparative X-ray in six months as advised by the radiologist. This will allow for a comparison of the two images and help determine if there are any changes or progression of the abnormality.

In the meantime, it is essential to monitor your symptoms closely. If you experience any new cough, difficulty breathing, or other concerning respiratory symptoms, it is important to seek medical attention promptly. Regular follow-up visits with your healthcare provider will also be crucial in assessing the nature and progression of the lung abnormality.

Remember, only a thorough evaluation by a healthcare professional who has reviewed the imaging and clinical findings can provide a definitive diagnosis and guide appropriate management.

### Response:Hello, I'm sorry to hear about your daughter's symptoms. The combination of fever and severe hair loss could be indicative of a few possible causes. Another possibility is an autoimmune condition called alopecia areata, where the body's immune system mistakenly attacks the hair follicles.

To determine the exact cause, it would be best to consult with a pediatrician or a dermatologist. They will be able to perform a thorough examination and possibly order some tests if necessary. In the meantime, you can try some remedies to potentially minimize hair loss. These include gently washing the hair with mild shampoo, avoiding excessive heat or chemical treatments, and using a soft-bristle brush when brushing the hair.

It's important to keep in mind that hair loss can have various causes, and it's always best to seek professional medical advice for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment.

### Response:Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you are experiencing a condition called hyperemesis gravidarum. This is a severe form of morning sickness that can cause persistent nausea, vomiting, and weight loss. The increased frequency of urination and burning feet may be due to the elevated levels of pregnancy hormones affecting your kidneys and circulation.

It is important to consult with your healthcare provider for a proper evaluation and management plan. They may recommend adjustments to your diet, medications to alleviate symptoms, and close monitoring of your baby's movements.

Please seek medical attention as soon as possible to ensure the well-being of both you and your baby.

input: Hello doctor,About 6 years ago, I engaged in some urethral play with my partner. I put a small pen into the urethra, only about 2 to 3 inches in. Since then, I feel I may have done damage to the smooth muscles in the corpus spongiosum or the tunica albuginea. I can feel, right inbetween the corpus spongiosum and corpus cavernosa what feels like an enlarged muscle and seem to run the entire length of the urethra, maybe compression damage done to something there. As a result, I have slight difficulty urinating and very very bad premature ejaculation which did not ever happen. I also have nocturnal emissions frequently on a full bladder. I know I may need to have an MRI, but if the muscles are damaged here, what are the surgical options? Can anything be done? I also tried Priligy and it made no difference (10 to 20 seconds).

### Response:Based on your description, it is possible that you may have caused damage to the smooth muscles in the corpus spongiosum or the tunica albuginea during urethral play. The symptoms you are experiencing, such as difficulty urinating and premature ejaculation, could be associated with this potential damage.

If the muscles in the urethra are indeed damaged, there are surgical options available to address the issue. One common surgical procedure for urethral strictures, which is the narrowing of the urethra due to scarring or fibrosis, is called a urethroplasty. This procedure involves reconstructing the damaged area of the urethra using various techniques, such as grafts from other parts of the body or synthetic materials.

Another surgical option is called a urethrostenosis, which involves removing the strictured portion of the urethra and repositioning the remaining urethral segments.

It is important to consult with a urologist who specializes in male sexual health to determine the extent of the damage and the most appropriate surgical option for you. They will consider factors such as the severity of your symptoms, the presence of any urinary complications, and your overall health to make an informed decision.

Additionally, it is worth mention

input: Hi doctor,I am suffering from severe hair loss since the past 45 days. I am only losing my hair on the top and front part of my head and it all started like a month ago. I am not using any medications right now.Basic Details: Male, 25 years old, 5\11", 154 lbs. Please suggest me medications to prevent hair loss and regrow my hair. Any help would be appreciated.
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I am suffering from severe hair loss since the past 45 days. I am only losing my hair on the top and front part of my head and it all started like a month ago. I am not using any medications right now.Basic Details: Male, 25 years old, 5\11", 154 lbs. Please suggest me medications to prevent hair loss and regrow my hair. Any help would be appreciated.

### Response:Based on the information you provided, it seems that you are experiencing male pattern baldness. This condition is common and usually occurs gradually over time.

There are several treatment options available for hair loss, including medications and non-medication approaches. Here are some suggestions:

1. Medications:
- Minoxidil: This is a topical solution or foam that you apply directly to the scalp. It helps to slow down hair loss and promotes hair regrowth in some cases.
- Finasteride: This is a prescription medication that works by blocking the conversion of testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT), a hormone that can contribute to hair loss.

2. Non-medication approaches:
- Hair transplantation: This involves moving hair follicles from areas with thick hair growth to areas of thinning or baldness.
- Laser therapy: Low-level laser devices can be used to stimulate hair follicles and promote hair growth.
- Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy: This involves injecting your own blood plasma, which contains growth factors, into the scalp to encourage hair regrowth.
- Nutritional supplements: Certain nutrients, such as zinc, biotin, and vitamin D, may support hair

To make your baby drink more at each meal, you can try the following:
1. Ensure that you are offering enough breast milk or formula. Aim for at least 120-150 ml of breast milk per meal for a 6-month-old baby.
2. Offer smaller, more frequent feeds throughout the day rather than a few large feeds.
3. Use a breast pump to express and store extra breast milk, which can be used as a supplement if needed.
4. Ensure proper latch and milk transfer during breastfeeding.
5. Seek assistance from a lactation consultant who can provide guidance on improving milk production and promoting better feeding.

The long-term effects of slow weight gain in infancy can vary depending on the severity and duration of the issue. It is important to address the weight gain concerns promptly to ensure optimal growth and development for your baby.

### Response:There can be several reasons for bleeding after sexual intercourse. It is important to gather more information about the patient's medical history and perform a thorough examination in order to determine the exact cause. However, based on the given information, some potential causes of bleeding after first-time sex include:

1. Vaginal tearing: If the hymen (a thin layer of tissue) is not fully stretched or torn before sexual intercourse, it can result in tearing and subsequent bleeding.

2. Vaginal infections: Certain infections such as yeast infections or bacterial vaginosis can cause inflammation and lead to bleeding.

3. Consensual injury: If there is trauma or injury to the vagina or cervix during sexual activity, it can result in bleeding.

4. Faulty contraceptives: Improper use of contraceptives, such as condoms that break during intercourse, can increase the risk of bleeding.

5. Hormonal imbalances: Certain hormonal imbalances, such as a hormonal imbalance before menstruation starts (menarche) or during menopause, can cause bleeding.

It is recommended to consult with a healthcare professional who can evaluate the patient's specific situation, perform a physical examination

input: Hi doctor,I have had redness in my eyes. I began using Tetryzoline but it had no effect. The redness has increased in the past two weeks. I recently began to experience pain around my eyes on the left side. I use to work on the computer for 8 hours a day. What medicine can I use that will cure the redness?

### Response:Based on your symptoms, it appears that you may be experiencing dry eye syndrome. This condition can cause redness, itching, and a gritty feeling in the eyes. The pain around your eyes could be a result of eye strain from prolonged computer use.

To cure the redness associated with dry eye syndrome, I would recommend using an over-the-counter artificial tears solution. These lubricating eye drops can help relieve the dryness and reduce inflammation. It is important to use them as directed and not to exceed the recommended usage.

Additionally, you may want to consider taking breaks from your computer screen every 20 minutes or so to rest your eyes and reduce eye strain. You could also try using a humidifier in your workspace to increase the moisture in the air, which can help prevent dryness.

If your symptoms persist or worsen despite using artificial tears, I would advise you to schedule an appointment with an ophthalmologist. They can further evaluate your condition and provide additional treatment options such as prescription eye drops or oral medications.

### Response:Based on the symptoms you have described, it is possible that you are experiencing discomfort or pressure due to the fit of your glasses. This phenomenon is known as "glasses pressure." 

There are a few things you can try to alleviate this discomfort:

1. Make sure your glasses have a nose bridge that fits snugly on your nose. A too-narrow or too-wide nose bridge can put pressure on the bridge of your nose and cause discomfort.

2. Ensure that the earpieces of your glasses are positioned properly. If the earpieces are too tight or too loose, it can affect the distribution of pressure on your head.

3. Adjust the temples (arms) of your glasses. If they are too long or too short, it can cause an imbalance in the distribution of pressure.

4. Consider getting a different pair of glasses with a different frame style or material. Different frames can fit differently and provide better comfort.

5. If the above modifications do not improve your symptoms, it may be helpful to consult with an optometrist or an ophthalmologist. They can evaluate your specific situation and provide further guidance on adjusting your glasses or recommending alternative options such as custom-made eyewear or sunglasses.

Remember, it

At 21st night of this month, I felt that my period has started and took one tablet at bedtime. But, yesterday and today I got only spotting and the period has not started properly. I am continuing the tablet regularly at night for the last two days. Should I continue to take the tablet regularly till completion of the pack of 21? Will protection start from the first month or do we have to use extra protection like a condom? Should I start taking a fresh pack on the first day of every period?

Therefore, you should not start a fresh pack of tablets on the first day of every period. Instead, continue taking the remaining tablets from the current pack until it is complete. Only then should you start a new pack of tablets on the following month.

In the meantime, if you are experiencing spotting or irregular bleeding, it is recommended to use extra protection such as a condom until your period returns to a more regular pattern. However, please note that this will not provide any additional protection against pregnancy.

If you continue to experience irregular bleeding or have concerns about your contraceptive method, it is best to consult with your doctor for further evaluation and guidance.

It is essential to have open communication with your child's healthcare team to understand their specific recommendations and any

### Response:As a medical expert, I can provide you with some information about frenectomies and the need for braces following the procedure.

A frenectomy is a dental surgery that involves the removal of the frenum, which is a small muscle that connects the front teeth to the gum tissue. This surgery is typically performed to correct a dental anomaly such as a gap between the front teeth (diastema).

The decision whether or not to place braces after a frenectomy depends on various factors, including the size of the gap and the overall orthodontic needs of the patient. In some cases, braces may be recommended to help align and straighten the teeth, especially if the gap is significant. Braces can also help guide the growth and development of the jawbones, ensuring proper alignment of the teeth over time.

However, it's important to note that every patient's situation is unique, and the need for braces cannot be determined without a comprehensive evaluation by a dental professional. Your dentist likely has assessed your specific case and determined that braces are not necessary at this time. It would be best to follow their recommendation and discuss any concerns you may have with them directly. They will be able to provide you with personalized advice based on your individual needs and oral health history.

But, this time it did not happen and I am totally freaked out and I did try sugar pregnancy test at home but it did not show any sign of pregnancy. What should I do now and my periods are delayed by I-pill or some other reasons. What should I do? Please help.

But, this time it did not happen and I am totally freaked out and I did try sugar pregnancy test at home but it did not show any sign of pregnancy. What should I do now and my periods are delayed by I-pill or some other reasons. What should I do? Please help.

### Response:Based on the information provided, it is possible that your delayed periods are due to the I-pill. The I-pill is a type of emergency contraception that can delay or prevent your period for up to a week. It is common for this medication to cause irregularities in your menstrual cycle initially.

However, if you are experiencing spotting and your periods are still delayed, it would be advisable to consult with a healthcare professional, such as your gynecologist. They will be able to evaluate your symptoms and determine the cause of your delayed periods.

In the meantime, it is important to monitor your symptoms closely and keep track of any changes in your menstrual cycle. If you notice any significant changes or if your symptoms worsen, it is recommended to seek medical attention promptly.

Remember, only a healthcare professional can provide an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment plan based on your individual situation.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hello doctor,How accurate in your opinion is the Lelli ACL (Lever test)? I am almost three months post-op of having my ACL reconstructed along with a few lesions addressed during the surgery. I am concerned I have ruptured my ACL again after feeling a short sharp pain when turning in the sand on vacation. It has been three days since the incident and the knee now feels a lot looser and I have some pain in different areas. I have tried the Lachman test with no noticeable shifting, and the Lelli test was positive with good leverage hopefully assisted by my intact ACL. I will have to see my surgeon and physio soon but I am just wondering how accurate the Lelli test is. There seems to be no difference when comparing the test in both knees.
raw_output:

### Instruction:

### Input:
Hello doctor,How accurate in your opinion is the Lelli ACL (Lever test)? I am almost three months post-op of having my ACL reconstructed along with a few lesions addressed during the surgery. I am concerned I have ruptured my ACL again after feeling a short sharp pain when turning in the sand on vacation. It has been three days since the incident and the knee now feels a lot looser and I have some pain in different areas. I have tried the Lachman test with no noticeable shifting, and the Lelli test was positive with good leverage hopefully assisted by my intact ACL. I will have to see my surgeon and physio soon but I am just wondering how accurate the Lelli test is. There seems to be no difference when comparing the test in both knees.

### Response:The Lelli ACL (Lever test) is a diagnostic test used to assess the integrity of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL). It involves applying a valgus stress to the knee while the patient bends the opposite leg.

In your case, you mentioned feeling a short sharp pain when turning in the sand on vacation, which could potentially indicate re-injury of the ACL. You also mentioned that the knee now feels looser and there is pain in different areas. These findings suggest a possible re-injury of the ACL.

The accuracy of the Lelli test in diagnosing ACL tears depends on various factors such as the skill and experience of the examiner, the patient's symptoms, and the presence of other injuries. While the test may not be 100% accurate, it can provide valuable information about the likelihood of an ACL tear.

In your case, since you have already undergone ACL reconstruction and there is no noticeable shift in the Lachman test, it is possible that the positive Lelli test with good leverage is indicative of a re-injury rather than an initial injury. However, it is important to consult with your surgeon and physio for a thorough evaluation and confirmation of the diagnosis.

In summary, the Lelli test can be a useful tool in assess

Hello doctor,Why do I have dry skin around my mouth and how can I treat it?

### Response:Dry skin around the mouth can be caused by several factors, including dehydration, cold weather, certain medications, and underlying medical conditions. To treat dry skin around the mouth, you can follow these steps:

1. Hydrate: Drink an adequate amount of water throughout the day to keep your body and skin well-hydrated.
2. Moisturize: Apply a gentle, fragrance-free moisturizer regularly, especially after bathing or showering. Look for moisturizers that contain ingredients such as hyaluronic acid, ceramides, or glycerin.
3. Avoid irritants: Avoid using harsh soaps, alcohol-based mouthwashes, and tobacco products, as they can further dry out the skin.
4. Use a humidifier: In dry environments or during the winter months, using a humidifier at home can help add moisture to the air and prevent dry skin.
5. Avoid excessive sun exposure: Protect your skin from the sun's harmful rays by wearing sunscreen and seeking shade, especially during peak sun hours.
6. Maintain a healthy diet: Ensure you are getting enough nutrients, especially vitamins A, C, D, and E, which are important for health

For acne scarring and hyperpigmentation, I recommend considering non-steroidal topical treatments such as azelaic acid or retinoids. These products help to exfoliate the skin, reduce inflammation, and promote collagen production, which can help improve the appearance of scars and dark spots.

2. Use a gentle exfoliant to remove dead skin cells and unclog pores.
3. Apply a moisturizer specifically designed for combination skin to hydrate and balance oil production.
4. Consider using a spot treatment containing ingredients like salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide to target blemishes.
5

### Response:Based on your symptoms and lab results, it appears that you may have low testosterone levels. The normal range for free testosterone in males is typically between 6-22 ng/dL, while total testosterone levels can vary depending on the laboratory but are usually between 300-1,000 ng/dL.

In your case, your free testosterone level of 9.2 ng/dL is significantly below the normal range, indicating a deficiency. Additionally, your total testosterone level of 485 ng/dL is also lower than the normal range.

Therefore, based on these results, it can be concluded that you have low testosterone levels. It is important to consult with a healthcare professional who specializes in hormonal imbalances, such as an endocrinologist or an anti-aging specialist, for further evaluation and appropriate treatment options.

input: Hello doctor, I have flown very often in the last few years. I forgot to wear earplugs and slept on a few flights recently. On the last two trips, I had multiple flights connecting. I noticed my ears did not stop popping after a few days. Since my last flight, my right ear has not cleared up. It used to be at night my ear would pop and get better during the day. Now my right ear has lost hearing, I would estimate about 50% and fluctuates between 50% to 75% during the day. When it is totally silent, I think I hear this tone in my right ear. I do not have headaches and can sleep fine. I have gingivitis and bleeding gums, and no other health issues. I was wondering if my ear is infected or not. I know whatever I have is connected to my frequent flying every two months for the last five years. I always wore earplugs and never had this before but forgot the last trip. Should I take antibiotic drops? I definitely have mucus in my sinus and I am not sneezing or coughing in any major way just and not sure if I am infected or not. Would antibiotic drops help me rule out infection?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hello doctor, I have flown very often in the last few years. I forgot to wear earplugs and slept on a few flights recently. On the last two trips, I had multiple flights connecting. I noticed my ears did not stop popping after a few days. Since my last flight, my right ear has not cleared up. It used to be at night my ear would pop and get better during the day. Now my right ear has lost hearing, I would estimate about 50% and fluctuates between 50% to 75% during the day. When it is totally silent, I think I hear this tone in my right ear. I do not have headaches and can sleep fine. I have gingivitis and bleeding gums, and no other health issues. I was wondering if my ear is infected or not. I know whatever I have is connected to my frequent flying every two months for the last five years. I always wore earplugs and never had this before but forgot the last trip. Should I take antibiotic drops? I definitely have mucus in my sinus and I am not sneezing or coughing in any major way just and not sure if I am infected or not. Would antibiotic drops help me rule out infection?

### Response:Based on your symptoms, it is possible that your ear is not infected but rather experiencing a condition called "barotrauma." Barotrauma occurs when there is damage to the middle ear due to changes in air pressure during flying or diving. The popping of your ears and the loss of hearing you are experiencing could be related to this condition.

It is important to note that barotrauma can cause temporary hearing loss, which may improve over time. However, if you have noticed a significant decrease in hearing and it has been persisting for more than a few days, it would be best to seek medical attention from an ear specialist or an otolaryngologist. They will be able to evaluate your symptoms and provide appropriate treatment recommendations.

In the meantime, avoid using antibiotic drops as they are not indicated for barotrauma. They are typically used for infections caused by bacteria. If your symptoms worsen or if you experience any new symptoms, such as severe pain or discharge from the ear, it is important to seek immediate medical attention.

6. Wear a nasal mask: Some dentists may recommend wearing a nasal mask that delivers a local

input: Hi doctor,I had unprotected sex with my wife on the fourth day of her menses and she took I-pill within 24 hours. The next day also we had unprotected sex and she again took an I-pill. After eight days, she bled and eight days later again she bled. She should get her menses by now, but still she did not get. We checked home pregnancy kit and it was negative. What could be the reason for delayed menses?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I had unprotected sex with my wife on the fourth day of her menses and she took I-pill within 24 hours. The next day also we had unprotected sex and she again took an I-pill. After eight days, she bled and eight days later again she bled. She should get her menses by now, but still she did not get. We checked home pregnancy kit and it was negative. What could be the reason for delayed menses?

### Response:Based on the information provided, there could be several reasons for the delayed menses. One possibility is that the I-pill may have caused a delay in her menstrual cycle. The I-pill is a hormonal contraceptive that works by inhibiting ovulation and thickening the cervical mucus to prevent sperm from reaching the egg. It is possible that the I-pill temporarily suppressed her menstrual cycle.

Another possibility is that there may be other underlying factors contributing to the delayed menses. These factors could include stress, changes in weight or exercise habits, certain medications, hormonal imbalances, or underlying medical conditions such as polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

It would be advisable for your wife to schedule an appointment with a healthcare provider to further evaluate the cause of her delayed menses. They will be able to conduct a thorough medical history and physical examination, as well as potentially order additional tests if necessary.

Additionally, following proper post-operative care instructions, including voice therapy exercises if recommended by your surgeon, can contribute to a successful recovery and optimal voice improvement.

### Response:Based on your description, the appearance of white and brown long particles in your stool may indicate the presence of meconium. Meconium is a mixture of waste products, mucus, and lanugo (a fine hair that covers the baby's skin during pregnancy) that is normally expelled from the baby's bowels before birth.

The fact that you have noticed this change recently and at 36 weeks of pregnancy is important to consider. It is possible that the meconium passage has been triggered by hormonal changes or other factors related to pregnancy. In most cases, meconium passage is considered normal and does not pose any immediate threat to the baby.

However, it is always advisable to consult with your healthcare provider to discuss any changes in your symptoms or concerns. They will be able to assess your specific situation, review your medical history, and conduct any necessary tests to ensure the well-being of both you and your baby.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.
input: Hi doctor,I have a question here. I had a toenail injury last month (cause: fell down, toe landing first onto the floor, which made the nail get loosened). I did go to the hospital to get it treated. The doctor cut off half of my nail, cleaned and dressed it, and kept re-visiting to get the dressing changed. The doctor said that I could stop re-visiting. And then she told me that the nail would have to be removed again after it grows back fully. But, I am hesitant and kind of rejecting to do so.After a month, the nail is not loose anymore, but the nail seems to be growing outwards, and between the nail and the nail bed, there is a gap (kind of like a hollow gap inside). Should I just wait until the nail fully grows back? Should I cut it? What should I do? I am really worried that it will not grow and it will completely fall off once I start wearing shoes. Please note: I am going on a horse riding and hiking camp the next month. Just in case if it does not grow back by then, what should I do or wear to protect it?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I have a question here. I had a toenail injury last month (cause: fell down, toe landing first onto the floor, which made the nail get loosened). I did go to the hospital to get it treated. The doctor cut off half of my nail, cleaned and dressed it, and kept re-visiting to get the dressing changed. The doctor said that I could stop re-visiting. And then she told me that the nail would have to be removed again after it grows back fully. But, I am hesitant and kind of rejecting to do so.After a month, the nail is not loose anymore, but the nail seems to be growing outwards, and between the nail and the nail bed, there is a gap (kind of like a hollow gap inside). Should I just wait until the nail fully grows back? Should I cut it? What should I do? I am really worried that it will not grow and it will completely fall off once I start wearing shoes. Please note: I am going on a horse riding and hiking camp the next month. Just in case if it does not grow back by then, what should I do or wear to protect it?

### Response:Based on the description you provided, it seems like you have a condition known as onycholysis. This is a separation between the nail plate and the nail bed, often caused by trauma.

Given that the nail is no longer loose and there is a gap between the nail and the nail bed, it is likely that the nail will continue to grow outwards. In this case, you can just continue to monitor the progress of the nail and wait for it to fully grow back.

However, if you are concerned about the appearance or function of your nail, you can consider trimming the nail to remove the portion that is growing abnormally. It would be best to consult with a healthcare professional, such as a podiatrist, who can assess the situation and provide personalized advice based on your specific condition.

For protection while wearing shoes, it is advisable to wear well-fitting shoes that do not put excessive pressure on the affected area. Additionally, using a nail hardener or protective polish may also help to strengthen the nail and prevent further damage.

If you have any further concerns or notice any signs of infection, such as redness, swelling, or pus, it is recommended to seek medical attention promptly.

input: Hi doctor,I am taking Larin Fe as a birth control pill. It is a combined monophasic pill with three weeks of active pills and one week of inactive pills. I currently started pill packs a week back but wanted to change it to a weekend to avoid weekend withdrawal bleeding. How can I do so without losing the effectiveness of the pill? My idea was to wait until my placebo week which starts on a weekday and then to take the placebos only up until weekend and start a new pack then. Would this work without changing the effectiveness of my pill?
raw_output:
Below is an instruction that describes a task, paired with an input that provides further context. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

### Input:
Hi doctor,I am taking Larin Fe as a birth control pill. It is a combined monophasic pill with three weeks of active pills and one week of inactive pills. I currently started pill packs a week back but wanted to change it to a weekend to avoid weekend withdrawal bleeding. How can I do so without losing the effectiveness of the pill? My idea was to wait until my placebo week which starts on a weekday and then to take the placebos only up until weekend and start a new pack then. Would this work without changing the effectiveness of my pill?

### Response:To change the day on which you start your birth control pill pack without losing its effectiveness, you can follow these steps:

1. Wait until you are in the middle of your active pill week.
2. Take the placebos (inactive pills) from the current pack until you reach the weekend.
3. Start a new pack immediately after finishing the placebos, even if it's a weekday.

This method should not affect the effectiveness of your birth control pill. However, it is always recommended to consult with your healthcare provider before making any changes to your medication regimen. They can provide personalized advice based on your specific situation.

It is important to protect your skin from direct sunlight by using sunscreen with a high SPF, wearing protective clothing such as hats and sunglasses, and seeking shade during peak sun hours.

2. Avoid tanning beds: Tanning beds emit harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation that can speed up the development of moles and increase their risk of becoming cancerous. It is best to avoid them completely.

If you notice any suspicious changes, such as asymmetry, irregular borders, or increased size, it is important to consult a dermatologist promptly.

For the past two to three days, the urgency kind of feels to be getting worse, I feel as if I will not be able to hold it. However, I am still able to as there is no leaking. There is no burning or irritation or any discharge. No recent sexual encounters and no other associated symptoms. I take Coveram 10/10 for essential hypertension and Valdoxan 25 because I also do suffer from anxiety. I have been under stress lately as I was doing my exams this past week and finished today.
